catalog_info.title: Open Minds, Wired Worlds: Computers and Cyberculture
catalog_info.description: From the birth of the electronic computer through the rise of social networking, this lecture course will trace both the eighty-year effort to create an electronic information machine, and the parallel effort to use this technology to enable people to create new kinds of communities. Beginning with the rise of information science and cybernetics, and continuing through the origins of digital logic and electronic computation, this course will explain the rise of smaller, faster, and more personal computers while examining the attendant political, social, and economic forces that spurred the development of a global communications network.
